Target: The Building Structure ontology (OntoBuildingStructure) is an ontology developed to represent the building structural components (walls, doors, slabs, roofs, stairs) and their individual characteristics such as dimensions and qualities.

Comment: An abstract class defining the attached construction parts of a building that constitute the building, such as walls, built-in partitions, roofs, doors, and columns. Generally, the building and all of its structural components are treated as a whole when the building is acquired, constructed, reconstructed, or erected and first placed in service.
Label: Building Structure Component

Comment: A vertical load-bearing structural member that is designed to support and transmit the load of the slab on the higher floors to the foundation through compression.
Label: Column

Comment: Upper interior surface component of any space in a construction, building, or infrastructure.
Label: Ceiling

Comment: Construction enclosing the building from above.
Label: Roof

Comment: Roof with a slope angle that is less than 9.46 degree.
Label: Flat Roof

Comment: Roof with a slope angle that is greater than or equal to 9.46 degree.
Label: Inclined Roof

Comment: Lower support component of any space in a construction, building, or infrastructure. It include a slab and flooring finish.
Label: Floor

Comment: Vertical construction usually in masonry or in concrete which bounds or subdivides a construction works and fulfills a load bearing or retaining function.
Label: Wall

Comment: Construction for closing a vertical or near vertical opening in a wall or pitched roof that will admit light and may admit fresh air.
Label: Window

Comment: Construction for closing an opening, intended primarily for access with hinged, pivoted or sliding operation.
Label: Door

Comment: Construction comprising a succession of horizontal stages (steps or landings) that make it possible to pass on foot to other levels. It can be treater as an assembly consisting of the following types: stair flights, railings, landings, and stair structural components.
Label: Stair

Comment: An assembly of building components in a single "run" of stair steps that are not interrupted by a landing.
Label: Stair Flight

Comment: A floor section that is connected to one or more stair flights or ramp flights.
Label: Landing

Comment: A frame assembly that is adjacent to human circulation spaces and at some space boundaries, in which it is used in lieu of walls or to complement walls. It is usually designed to aid humans, either as an optional physical support, or to prevent injury by falling.
Label: Railing

Comment: A structural member designed to carry loads between or beyond points of support for a staircase.
Label: Stair Structural Component
